LlrApplication.title: LlrApplication
LlrApplication.description: Represents a Learner's License Registration application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the LLR application.

applicantDob.description: Date of birth of the applicant.

documentOther.description: Reference number of other relevant document.

submissionDate.description: Date and time when the application was submitted.

params.name: llraId
params.description: Unique identifier for the LLR application.

firestore.reasoning: Given the requirement for a LLR Registration form and storing the application data in Firestore, a simple collection-based structure is recommended. The application stores LLR application data in the `LLR_Applications` collection. There is no user-specific data or complex relationships to manage, so a flat structure is appropriate. The application stores the data directly to firestore and there are no users so it is unnecessary to implement the Authorization Independence and other complex strategies. The app's only purpose is to display the password along with the username if user forget the password. Although that is not ideal from the security perspective it is a requirement.
